comments:
In WSAD 5.1.1, I am able to select a method from the Outline view and hit Ctrl-
C to Copy the method definition to the clipboard.  If I do that in Eclipse 
3.0.1, I get a message box that says "The command for the key you pressed 
failed.  Reason: null argument;"

Do you have something in <your workspace\.metadata\.log ? If you do, please
attach it to this bug.

Created an attachment (id=15014)
Log file as requested

Snippet for your reference.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Oct 05, 2004 11:54:30.754
!MESSAGE null argument;
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.Assert$AssertionFailedException: null argument;

	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.Assert.isNotNull(Assert.java:105)

Please provide a test case to reproduce this problem.

Moving to JDT UI as the exception happens in refactoring code.

I just happened to notice it, but I don't remember how I got there.  I figured 
you all would want to know since I never saw it once in all the time I've used 
WSAD 5.1.1 which has been over 8 months...

If I see it again, I'll try to remember to write down the steps performed.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 68279 ***
